availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Phidello W. Hall (Limestone County, Texas, attorney and soldier. 11th Kentucky Cavalary)

body.p: Limestone County, Texas, attorney and soldier. Barren County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas Jefferson Hall and Sarah Hall. Married to Corine Vansickles in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on December 21, 1864. Father of William Hall. Resident of Limestone County, Texas, in 1850. Admitted to the bar in Robinson County, Texas, in October 1859. Attorney in Limestone County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant from December 19, 1863, to May 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Texas, Limestone County, Precinct 1, p. 359B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Texas, Limestone County, p. 345.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Texas, Travis County, Austin, p. 314B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000819619.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 108.
"Phidello William Hall (1838-1888)," Find A Grave, Memorial 38744105, accessed May 29, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/38744105.
